metadata.title: CVE-2021-36367 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: PuTTY through 0.75 proceeds with establishing an SSH session even if it hasnever sent a substantive authentication response. This makes it easier foran attacker-controlled SSH server to present a later spoofed authenticationprompt (that the attacker can use to capture credential data, and use thatdata for purposes that are undesired by the client user).

criterions.comment: putty: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
